description.narrative: Newko Balkan SH.P.K (Newko Balkan or the Company), a Republic of Kosovo-based manufacturer of conveyor belts, seeks a senior IFC A loan of up to EUR4 million (the IFC Loan) to help fund (i) the Companys COVID-related working capital needs and (ii) upgrade investments to increase efficiency and expand production operations (the Project). The Project will be IFCs second engagement with the Company following IFCs initial investment in 2010 to support Newko Balkans post-privatization ramp-up and refurbishment investments.

The proposed south-south Project is expected to: (i) create additional jobs and preserve more than 230 direct jobs while increasing purchases from local suppliers; (ii) contribute to foreign exchange generation through strong export sales; (iii) benefit domestic consumers by ensuring access to lower cost, high quality locally produced conveyor belts; and (iv) promote the resilience of the conveyor belt production activities in Kosovo by supporting the only local conveyor belt producer.
